abstract: The consequences of the rotten Wall Street model — where prudence was replaced by taking big, unbalanced risks with shareholders’ and creditors’ money — were laid bare in the 2,200-page autopsy of the collapse of Lehman Brothers that was made public by the bankruptcy court last week, William D. Cohan writes on Opinionator.
